title: George W Bush and Ellen DeGeneres sit together at Dallas Cowboys game
text:
Ellen DeGeneres and George W. Bush sat next to one another at the Dallas Cowboys game on Sunday, and viewers had a lot to say about the unlikely duo.

The pair was sitting in a private suite apparently owned by Cowboys owner Jerry Jones and were briefly shown on the Fox broadcast of the game, according to USA Today.

Bush's wife, Laura, and DeGeneres' wife, Portia de Rossi, were also in attendance.

Photos of Bush and DeGeneres showed the two chatting and laughing together as they watched the Cowboys lose to the Green Bay Packers.

Shortly after they were displayed during the broadcast, several viewers took to social media to express their mixed feelings about Bush and DeGeneres sitting together.

Ellen DeGeneres and George W. Bush sat next to one another at the Dallas Cowboys game on Sunday, and viewers had a lot to say about the unlikely duo

Shortly after they were displayed during a Fox broadcast, several viewers took to social media to express their mixed feelings about Bush and DeGeneres sitting together

ESPN commentator Clinton Yates tweeted: 'Ellen sitting next to Dubya definitely qualified as a Sunday shocker.'

Another tweeted: 'Name a more weird couple.'

Others joked that they would watch a sitcom featuring DeGeneres and Bush.

One person wrote: 'George W. Bush cracking jokes with Ellen at the #GBvsDAL game is the best thing to happen this year.'

Just Ellen DeGeneres hanging out with her buddy George W. Bush, taking in a football game. pic.twitter.com/lBjKUDypAP — Parker Molloy (@ParkerMolloy) October 6, 2019

Meanwhile, others weren't so happy about DeGeneres sitting with Bush.

'I don't care how nice of a guy George W Bush is. He was one of our worst presidents and left our country and world in bad shape. The mess he helped create we're still trying to dig out of,' journalist, Aaron Rupar tweeted.

'This is a bad look for @TheEllenShow,' Rupar added.

Writer and activist Parker Molloy called DeGeneres' decision to hang out with Bush a 'bold choice'.

'Bold choice for @TheEllenShow to hang out with GWB 2 days before SCOTUS (which now includes his former staff secretary Kavanaugh) will hear a case about whether it will be legal to discriminate against LGBTQ people in employment.'

Molloy was referring to the upcoming case that the Supreme Court will dive into on Tuesday.

The case revolves around the issue of whether it is legal to fire someone because of their sexual orientation or gender identity.

Trump's Republican administration argues that lawmakers in the past were not addressing gay rights when employment discrimination over 'race, color, religion, sex, or national origin' was banned.

LGBTQ campaigners, who won a major victory in 2015 when the court guaranteed the right to gay marriage, are calling on judges to ensure gay and transgender people are covered by the discrimination ban.

But others disagreed and said that their public appearance together should 'give you hope for our future'.
